p: Cyclophosphamide causes damage to the urinary bladder and it might cause renal toxicity. 8 It has been revealed that generation of oxidative and nitrative stress plays an important role in the pathogenesis of cyclophosphamide-induced nephrotoxicity. 3 In addition, cyclophosphamide decreases the activities of lysosomal protein digestive enzymes, which leads to the amassing of abnormal amounts of protein in the kidney; this might be another possible reason for cyclophosphamide-induced nephrotoxicity. 9
